entry.title: web2py deployment
entry.summary:
Todo

  • Update article to reflect new document path: /var/www instead of /home/www-data
  • Update the webserver ports: 8080 and 8443 instead of the default 80 and 443. This also include changes to the apache config file and ports.conf (not yet documented)
  • postgres user config and database setup including dump and restore of data
  • enable secure access only in web2py model db.py

Platform

Linux distro depends on personal preference but I recommend Debian stable. Debian 6.0 or Debian 7.0 "Wheezy" as of May 4th 2013.

Applications

web2py offers an installation script to install apache+python+mod_wsgi+web2py+postgresql from scratch. Application versions that will be retrieved are outdated and the proposed document root is not optimal. Recommendation is to use the script as a guideline.

wget http://web2py.googlecode.com/hg/scripts/setup-web2py-ubuntu.sh
chmod +x setup-web2py-ubuntu.sh
sudo ./setup-web2py-ubuntu.sh

Below are the proposed packages:

apt-get -y install ssh
apt-get -y install zip unzip
apt-get -y install tar
apt-get -y install openssh-server
apt-get -y install build-essential
apt-get -y install python2.5
apt-get -y install ipython
apt-get -y install python-dev
apt-get -y install postgresql
apt-get -y install apache2
apt-get -y install libapache2-mod-wsgi
apt-get -y install python2.5-psycopg2
apt-get -y install postfix
apt-get -y install wget
apt-get -y install python-matplotlib
apt-get -y install python-reportlab
apt-get -y install mercurial

I recommend installing python2.7 with the corresponding postgres driver (pyscopg2).

Packages postfix, wget, python-matplotlib, python-reportlab and mercurial seem optional imho.

Postgresql

Tested with version 8.4

Apache

modules

a2enmod ssl
a2enmod proxy
a2enmod proxy_http
a2enmod headers
a2enmod expires
a2enmod wsgi

self-signed certicate

mkdir /etc/apache2/ssl
openssl genrsa 1024 > /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.key
chmod 400 /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.key
openssl req -new -x509 -nodes -sha1 -days 365 -key /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.key > /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.cert
openssl x509 -noout -fingerprint -text < /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.cert > /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.info

mod_wsgi

Replace /etc/apache2/sites-available/default with the config below.

NameVirtualHost *:80
NameVirtualHost *:443
# If the WSGIDaemonProcess directive is specified outside of all virtual
# host containers, any WSGI application can be delegated to be run within
# that daemon process group.
# If the WSGIDaemonProcess directive is specified
# within a virtual host container, only WSGI applications associated with
# virtual hosts with the same server name as that virtual host can be
# delegated to that set of daemon processes.
WSGIDaemonProcess web2py user=www-data group=www-data

<VirtualHost *:80>
  WSGIProcessGroup web2py
  WSGIScriptAlias / /home/www-data/web2py/wsgihandler.py
  WSGIPassAuthorization On

  <Directory /home/www-data/web2py>
    AllowOverride None
    Order Allow,Deny
    Deny from all
    <Files wsgihandler.py>
      Allow from all
    </Files>
  </Directory>

  AliasMatch ^/([^/]+)/static/(.*) \
           /home/www-data/web2py/applications/$1/static/$2
  <Directory /home/www-data/web2py/applications/*/static/>
    Options -Indexes
    Order Allow,Deny
    Allow from all
  </Directory>

  <Location /admin>
  Deny from all
  </Location>

  <LocationMatch ^/([^/]+)/appadmin>
  Deny from all
  </LocationMatch>

  CustomLog /var/log/apache2/access.log common
  ErrorLog /var/log/apache2/error.log
</VirtualHost>

<VirtualHost *:443>
  SSLEngine on
  SSLCertificateFile /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.cert
  SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/apache2/ssl/self_signed.key

  WSGIProcessGroup web2py
  WSGIScriptAlias / /home/www-data/web2py/wsgihandler.py
  WSGIPassAuthorization On

  <Directory /home/www-data/web2py>
    AllowOverride None
    Order Allow,Deny
    Deny from all
    <Files wsgihandler.py>
      Allow from all
    </Files>
  </Directory>

  AliasMatch ^/([^/]+)/static/(.*) \
        /home/www-data/web2py/applications/$1/static/$2

  <Directory /home/www-data/web2py/applications/*/static/>
    Options -Indexes
    ExpiresActive On
    ExpiresDefault "access plus 1 hour"
    Order Allow,Deny
    Allow from all
  </Directory>

  CustomLog /var/log/apache2/access.log common
  ErrorLog /var/log/apache2/error.log
</VirtualHost>

restart apache

/etc/init.d/apache2 restart

web2py admin access

cd /home/www-data/web2py
sudo -u www-data python -c "from gluon.widget import console; console();"
sudo -u www-data python -c "from gluon.main import save_password; save_password(raw_input('admin password: '),443)"

web2py

Important: download the latest developer version instead of the regular stable release. The stable version has a bug which breaks the app and this seems to be fixed in the latest test release.

cd /home
mkdir www-data
cd www-data
cd /home/www-data/
sudo wget http://web2py.com/examples/static/web2py_src.zip
sudo unzip web2py_src.zip
sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /home/www-data/web2py

entry.title: Postgresql - adding serial id field ex post facto
entry.summary:
How to add an autoincrement field in a given postgresql table retrospectively?

Tested in version 8.4.

the table consists of two fields which are both references to the id field in other tables but there was no need for an ID field. A situation came up where we require to have a PK ID field with an automatic incremental integer value.

Before

cmdb=> \d tblasset_sw

    Table "public.tblasset_sw"
Column  |  Type   | Modifiers
----------+---------+-----------
asset_id | integer |
sw_id    | integer |
Foreign-key constraints:
    "tblasset_sw_asset_id_fkey" FOREIGN KEY (asset_id) REFERENCES tblasset(asset_id)
    "tblasset_sw_sw_id_fkey" FOREIGN KEY (sw_id) REFERENCES tblsw(sw_id)

Steps

  • Create a sequence table
  • Add the new ID column
  • Populate the id field with an autoincrement number for the existing records
  • Alter the ID column to automatically assign the next available value when creating new records
  • Add an extra 'NOT NULL' constraint (this could probably have been added on creation of the new column as well)
cmdb=> create SEQUENCE tblasset_sw_asset_sw_id_seq;
cmdb=> ALTER TABLE tblasset_sw ADD asset_sw_id INT UNIQUE;
cmdb=> UPDATE tblasset_sw SET asset_sw_id  = NEXTVAL('tblasset_sw_asset_sw_id_seq');
cmdb=> ALTER TABLE ONLY tblasset_sw ALTER COLUMN asset_sw_id SET DEFAULT nextval('tblasset_sw_asset_sw_id_seq'::regclass);
cmdb=> ALTER TABLE ONLY tblasset_sw ALTER COLUMN asset_sw_id SET NOT NULL;

After

cmdb=> \d tblasset_sw
                                Table "public.tblasset_sw"
Column    |  Type   |                             Modifiers
-------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------------------------
asset_id    | integer |
sw_id       | integer |
asset_sw_id | integer | not null default nextval('tblasset_sw_asset_sw_id_seq'::regclass)
Indexes:
    "tblasset_sw_asset_sw_id_key" UNIQUE, btree (asset_sw_id)
Foreign-key constraints:
    "tblasset_sw_asset_id_fkey" FOREIGN KEY (asset_id) REFERENCES tblasset(asset_id)
    "tblasset_sw_sw_id_fkey" FOREIGN KEY (sw_id) REFERENCES tblsw(sw_id)

entry.title: Gnuplot chart in ascii block
entry.summary:
Given a simple 2 column text file as input file with the first column representing file size in bytes and the second column the timestamps in format Y-m-d.

24481664624 2010-10-17
49741909424 2010-10-18
50440904239 2010-10-19
51971254861 2010-10-20
51887934671 2010-10-21
48200114182 2010-10-22
27754927745 2010-10-23
24365406074 2010-10-24
47137848754 2010-10-25
46625748303 2010-10-26

Create a gnuplot command file with following contents:

set terminal dumb
set grid front
set nokey
set xdata time
set timefmt "%Y-%m-%d"
set xrange ["2012-05-01":"2013-05-01"]
set format x "%m/%y"
set ylabel "Volume (GB)"
set xlabel "Time"
set style fill solids
plot "syslog_stats.txt" using 2:($1/1073741824) w lines

Output chart appears in the active terminal as an ascii block
